    • Method Detail

      • findShortestPathFromString

        public int findShortestPathFromString(java.lang.String start,
                                      java.lang.String end)
        findShortestPathFromString: Calculates whether a path from start to end is valid given the provided number of steps. Input Strings: "H3" or "G13"
        Parameters:
        start - the starting Cell on the map.
        end - the desired cell on the map.
        Returns:
        true valid, false otherwise.

      • findShortestPath

        public int findShortestPath(Cell start,
                            Cell end)
        findShortestPath: Calculates the shortest number of steps to a given cell.
        Parameters:
        start - the starting Cell on the map.
        end - the desired cell on the map.
        Returns:
        int number of steps using shortest path, or Integer.MAX_VALUE if none can be found.

      • findExactPathFromString

        public boolean findExactPathFromString(java.lang.String start,
                                       java.lang.String end,
                                       int steps)
        findShortestPath: Calculates whether there is a valid path from start to end using exactly 'steps' moves. NOTE: - Each room counts as only 1 step. - You cannot visit a cell more than once in a turn. - A turn is valid even with steps remaining if there is a path to the target room (if there is one) that is only shorter that 'steps'
        Parameters:
        start - the starting Cell on the map.
        end - the desired cell on the map.
        steps - the number of steps that have to be taken.
        Returns:
        true path was found meeting parameters, false otherwise.

      • findExactPath

        public boolean findExactPath(Cell start,
                             Cell end,
                             int steps)
        findShortestPath: Calculates whether there is a valid path from start to end using exactly 'steps' moves. NOTE: - Each room counts as only 1 step. - You cannot visit a cell more than once in a turn. - A turn is valid even with steps remaining if there is a path to the target room (if there is one) that is only shorter that 'steps'
        Parameters:
        start - the starting Cell on the map.
        end - the desired cell on the map.
        steps - the number of steps that have to be taken.
        Returns:
        true path was found meeting parameters, false otherwise.

      • getDistance

        public double getDistance(Cell a,
                          Cell b)
        getDistance: Return the Euclidean distance of a Cell from another Cell. (Based on Pythagorean Theorem using row and cols).
        Parameters:
        a - Cell to measure distance from.
        b - Cell to measure distance to.
        Returns:
        Distance between Cells.
